posts.cooked:
We’ve tried re-soldering it. Devices on both ends of the CAN bus all show up, just not the encoder. The encoder lights up fine (it shows flashing green when mounted). IMG_20230317_173839 1920×2560 185 KB

IMG_20230317_173839 1920×2560 185 KB

IMG_20230317_173839 1920×2560 185 KB

posts.name: burde1jb
posts.cooked:
Are other CANcoders showing up?

I ask because this may be a case of multiple CANcoders having the same CAN ID and therefore you see one CANcoder even if there are multiple physically connected on your bot and powered.
No, none of them showed up
Sometimes the encoder does blink red before it does green. I have a suspicion that it’s still a soldering problem.
No it only flashes red a few times and then stays green

posts.name: burde1jb
posts.cooked:
Can you take a screenshot of your Phoenix Tuner when booted up?

And will you post a picture of your connections, not at the CANcoder, but to whatever you are connecting to?
Unfortunately, I don’t have access to that at the moment but the device list only showed our motor controllers which were two Talon FXs and two Victor SPXs. I can give more pictures tomorrow.

posts.name: burde1jb
posts.cooked: This is leaning toward a CAN wiring issue to me. I would be going back to the roboRIO and tracing my CAN path looking for a loose wire or a flipped connection (green/yellow).
I wouldn’t think so because devices on both sides of the encoders are being recognised just fine, just not the encoder.
